title: About
text:
Plot

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt


df = sns.load_dataset("penguins")
print(df)

# INSERT YOUR SOLUTION HERE
sns.set_theme(style='white',palette='Pastel1')
FS=18
g=sns.relplot(
    data=df,
    x='bill_length_mm',
    y='flipper_length_mm',
    hue='species',
    col='island',
    s=200
)
print(type(g))
g.axes[0,0].set_xlabel('Penguin bill length (mm)', fontsize=FS)
g.axes[0,1].set_xlabel('Penguin bill length (mm)', fontsize=FS)
g.axes[0,2].set_xlabel('Penguin bill length (mm)', fontsize=FS)
g.axes[0,0].set_ylabel('Penguin flipper length (mm)', fontsize=FS)
g.axes[0,0].set_title("Torgersen Island",fontsize=FS)
g.axes[0,1].set_title("Biscoe Island",fontsize=FS)
g.axes[0,2].set_title("Dream Island",fontsize=FS)
for i in range(0,3):
    g.axes[0,i].tick_params(axis='both', which='major', labelsize=FS)

plt.setp(g._legend.get_texts(), fontsize=FS)
plt.setp(g._legend.get_title(), fontsize=FS)

plt.savefig('plot-1.pdf', bbox_inches='tight')

title: DSAN5000-Lab1.2
text:
Footnotes


Here is the footnote.↩︎
Here’s one with multiple blocks.
Subsequent paragraphs are indented to show that they belong to the previous footnote.
{ some.code }
The whole paragraph can be indented, or just the first line. In this way, multi-paragraph footnotes work like multi-paragraph list items.↩︎

title: NLP
text:
A Literature Review

Author: Kang, Yue; Cai, Zhao; Tan, Chee-Wee; Huang, Qian; Liu, Hefu
Keywords: Natural language processing; literature review; sentiment analysis; machine learning

title: NLP
text:
Abstract

Natural language processing (NLP) is gaining momentum in management research for its ability to automatically analyze and comprehend human language. Yet, despite its extensive application in management research, there is neither a comprehensive review of extant literature on such applications, nor is there a detailed walkthrough on how it can be employed as an analytical technique.

title: NLP
text:
Abstract

To this end, we review articles in the UT Dallas List of 24 Leading Business Journals that employ NLP as their focal analytical technique to elucidate how textual data can be harnessed for advancing management theories across multiple disciplines. We describe the available toolkits and procedural steps for employing NLP as an analytical technique as well as its advantages and disadvantages. In so doing, we highlight the managerial and technological challenges associated with the application of NLP in management research in order to guide future inquires.

title: NLP
section: Natural Language Processing (NLP) in Management Research
